title: demonstration faces
content: If you were going to create a short list of frakturs, rotundas, schwabachers, and texturas, with the goal of illustrating the distinctions between the groups, which typefaces would you include?
author: ChristTrekker

comments.content:
A great resource for this:  
 [http://www.alibris.com/Blackletter-Type-and-National-Identity/book/9255226](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317234430/http:/www.alibris.com/Blackletter-Type-and-National-Identity/book/9255226 "http://www.alibris.com/Blackletter-Type-and-National-Identity/book/9255226")

hhp

You could be interested also in this:  
 [http://www.alterlittera.com/al\_htm/bookhand.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317234430/http:/www.alterlittera.com/al_htm/bookhand.htm "http://www.alterlittera.com/al\_htm/bookhand.htm")  
 [http://www.alterlittera.com/al\_htm/oldtype.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317234430/http:/www.alterlittera.com/al_htm/oldtype.htm "http://www.alterlittera.com/al\_htm/oldtype.htm")
Oops, I just realized I posted in the critique/blackletter forum, I meant to be in the SIG/blackletter forum. If there's a way to move it, that would be great.

Hi! Can anyone recommend a letter don't where the capital 'E' is the shape of the 'C'?  
Many thanks!
